CUDA on WSL User Guide
The guide for using NVIDIA CUDA on Windows Subsystem for Linux.


1. NVIDIA GPU Accelerated Computing on WSL 2ï

WSL or Windows Subsystem for Linux is a Windows feature that enables users to run native Linux applications, containers and command-line tools directly on Windows 11 and later OS builds. CUDA support in this user guide is specifically for WSL 2, which is the second generation of WSL that offers the following benefits

Linux applications can run as is in WSL 2. WSL 2 is characteristically a VM with a Linux WSL Kernel in it that provides full compatibility with mainstream Linux kernel allowing support for native Linux applications including popular Linux distros.
Faster file system support and thatâs more performant.
WSL 2 is tightly integrated with the Microsoft Windows operating system, which allows it to run Linux applications alongside and even interop with other Windows desktop and modern store apps.

For the rest of this user guide, WSL and WSL 2 may be used interchangeably.
Typically, developers working acr

run_info.output: The NVIDIA GPU Accelerated Computing on WSL 2 is a user guide for using NVIDIA CUDA on Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL). WSL is a Windows feature that allows users to run native Linux applications, containers, and command-line tools directly on Windows 11 and later OS builds. The guide specifically focuses on WSL 2, which is the second generation of WSL that offers faster file system support and full compatibility with mainstream Linux kernel allowing support for native Linux applications. The guide provides steps for installing NVIDIA driver for GPU support, setting up a Linux development environment, and troubleshooting common errors.

message.content: The NVIDIA GPU Accelerated Computing on WSL 2 is a user guide for using NVIDIA CUDA on Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL). WSL is a Windows feature that allows users to run native Linux applications, containers, and command-line tools directly on Windows 11 and later OS builds. The guide specifically focuses on WSL 2, which is the second generation of WSL that offers faster file system support and full compatibility with mainstream Linux kernel allowing support for native Linux applications. The guide provides steps for installing NVIDIA driver for GPU support, setting up a Linux development environment, and troubleshooting common errors.
